column2: ARKANSAS DMV DRIVING TEST
Question Text
1. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
2. At a red traffic light with a green arrow, you may proceed in the direction of the arrow:
column4: after making a complete stop first.
column6: if you wait until the light changes.
column8: if you are in the proper lane and the roadway is clear.

column2: 3. A flashing yellow light means:
column6: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: The light will soon change from green to red.

column2: 4. If a tire suddenly goes flat while you are driving, you should:
column4: pump the brake pedal 5-7 times until the vehicle stops.
column6: slow down gradually do not apply the brake.
column8: apply the brake firmly and stop.

column2: 5. When changing lanes:
column4: change lane before checking the inside rearview mirror.
column6: slow down and check your left mirror.
column8: look over your shoulder to make sure no one is in the blind spot.

column2: 6. When you are facing a green light and there are pedestrians in the intersection:
column4: you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
column6: you have the right-of-way over pedestrians.
column8: you must signal your intention to cross the intersection at least 100 feet before yielding the right-of-way.

column2: 7. When pedestrians are in a crosswalk, drivers should:
column4: pull over to the right and stop.
column8: go ahead because drivers have the right-of-way.

9. A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:

11. If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
column6: help create a safe driving environment.
column8: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.

column2: 12. You are driving at night, and a vehicle comes toward you with their high beam headlights on. You should:
column4: look in the direction of the vehicle.

column2: 13. This sign indicates:
14. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 15. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column6: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column8: must always come to a complete stop.

column2: 16. Broken yellow lines:
column4: indicate you are in a no passing zone.
column6: separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
column8: separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.

column2: 17. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column6: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 18. If you park facing uphill where there is NO curb, you should set the parking brake and:
column4: turn the wheels toward the edge of the road.
column6: turn the wheels toward the curb.

21. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
22. You should increase your following distance:
column4: at night or if it is raining.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
24. Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
column4: you are not wearing safety belts.
column6: you don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.
column8: you are following a bicyclist or motorcyclist across railroad tracks.

column2: 25. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: there is a one lane bridge ahead.
